meanings.sent1: After realizing the cake was too big, she decided to resplit it into smaller pieces.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter had to resplit the wood to make it fit the measurements.
meanings.sent3: The magician attempted to resplit the rabbit into two, but ended up with a hat full of carrots instead.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt like resplitting into a million tiny shards when she heard the sad news.
meanings.sent5: The thunder resplit the silence of the night, startling the sleeping cat.

meanings.sent1: The resplitting of the document caused confusion among the team members.
meanings.sent2: The resplitting of the cake led to equal portions for everyone at the party.
meanings.sent3: The resplitting of the river into multiple streams created a beautiful natural landscape.
meanings.sent4: The resplitting of the atom unleashed immense energy, changing the course of history.
meanings.sent5: The resplitting of the clouds allowed the sun to peek through, brightening up the gloomy day.

meanings.definition: To divide into smaller parts again
meanings.sent1: She had to resplit the large pizza into smaller slices to share with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The chef decided to resplit the ingredients to make individual portions of the dish.
meanings.sent3: The teacher had to resplit the class into smaller groups for the group project.
meanings.sent4: The storm resplit the tree into multiple branches, scattering leaves everywhere.
meanings.sent5: The artist resplit the canvas into sections to work on different parts of the painting.
